data.text: @emma1293 The vaccine prevents you from getting ill, but doesn't prevent you from being a carrier and thus making other people ill
@emma1293 For those that haven't gotten it yet. There's the potential of viral mutation that then makes the vaccine moot.
@emma1293 You don't have to according to WHO, but everyone's answers about still able to be a carrier of the disease is correct.
@emma1293 Getting vaccinated is like having winter tires in winter. It helps but You should still be careful. Also there are virus mutations…
@emma1293 Because there’s a chance you can still carry the virus
@emma1293 Because of the twats who won't get vaxed and want to steal the immunity from your breath?

@emma1293 Because it doesn't prevent them to "share" the virus if they are infected. The vaccine only prevent them to suffer from the virus. 
As there is still a lot of people who aren't fully vaccinated, we all have to wear masks
@emma1293 you can still carry the virus if you’re double vaccinated (even though you have no symptoms!). so wearing a mask is still important to protect other people who aren’t vaccinated
